content.p: Berkeley DBXML is a native embedded XML database. Formerly developed by Sleepycat and now a part of Oracle, DBXML is based on the open-source Berkeley database engine. This library provides a tool library for managing and querying XML document repositories in DBXML.
This library requires that DBXML is installed on your host operating system. You can download the latest version here.

A model is a DBXML container configured in /etc/dbxml_config where the container for current model is named. The library supports opening the current model, deleting it and querying it. It also supports creating new model elements, getting elements, updating them and deleting them.
